intro: Veronica dissecta subsp. dissecta, commonly known as the slender speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features slender, upright stems that are often branched and covered in fine, hairy hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped, finely dissected, and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small, blue to purple, and typically borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. This species thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or alpine habitats.
